item.name: Spaceballs
item.overview: When the nefarious Dark Helmet hatches a plan to snatch Princess Vespa and steal her planet's air, space-bum-for-hire Lone Starr and his clueless sidekick fly to the rescue. Along the way, they meet Yogurt, who puts Lone Starr wise to the power of "The Schwartz." Can he master it in time to save the day?

topic.name: animals are abused
topic.keywords: animal pet abuse torture blood cage trap neglect beaten skinned starve
topic.description: Some animals don't necessarily die, but are severely abused. Are there graphic details about animals being beaten, bloodied, skinned  alive, trapped in cages, starved, or neglected?

topic.name: a pet dies
topic.description: I'm glad that there are already categories for animals dying, as well as categories for animals commonly kept as pets dying (such as dogs, cats, and horses). However, I feel like the death of a pet should be its own category - some may find the death of an animal upsetting enough, but it can be even worse when the animal in question belonged to someone. Also, those who have lost a pet recently may want to avoid watching another pet die.

topic.name: there's dog fighting
topic.description: Dog fighting is forcing dogs to fight each other for the sake of human entertainment. It’s gruesome, heartbreaking, and cruel.
topic.subtitle: ASPCA - Dog Fighting

topic.name: there's a dead animal
topic.keywords: puppy kitten dog cat horse cow

topic.name: someone gets gaslighted
topic.description: Gaslighting is a form of psychological manipulation that seeks to sow seeds of doubt in a targeted individual or in members of a targeted group, making them question their own memory, perception, and sanity (Wikipedia). It’s no fun to be watching a film only for a character to find out they’ve been lied to and/or manipulated the whole movie.

topic.name: someone is stalked
topic.description: Stalking can often appear as something small online but builds up over time and can lead to harassment and even violence from the perpetrator. It is an uncomfortable and distressing subject that some may not wish to view.

topicItemStats.comment: I mean... The princess is literally treated like a child and is presumably around 18. And she is bein forced into a marriage; which is entirely abuse of a person that is being treated like a child.

comments.comment: I mean... The princess is literally treated like a child and is presumably around 18. And she is bein forced into a marriage; which is entirely abuse of a person that is being treated like a child.

topic.name: there's addiction
topic.description: A character has any sort of addiction, which includes gambling, tobacco or even anything that can be seen or used as a joke.

topic.name: someone is restrained
topic.description: A character is restrained. They have limited movement due to an outside source (not the same as paralysis). Example: a character is tied up, or has limbs encased with dried concrete.

topic.name: there's excessive gore
topic.description: Some people can handle a bit of blood, but not things like organs and bones.

topicItemStats.comment: There's a scene where someone is shaving and another scene where a plastic surgeon is sharpening a knife and about to operate, though the operation itself doesn't take place.

comments.comment: There's a scene where someone is shaving and another scene where a plastic surgeon is sharpening a knife and about to operate, though the operation itself doesn't take place.

topicItemStats.comment:
The villain fires a ray of energy at a subordinates crotch, which causes them extreme pain but no detail is shown.

Starts at 5:27 and ends at 5:39.

topic.name: there's genital trauma/mutilation
topic.keywords: penis vagina groin balls scrotum testicles

comments.comment:
The villain fires a ray of energy at a subordinates crotch, which causes them extreme pain but no detail is shown.

topic.name: there's cannibalism
topic.description: Although they have already proposed the categories "Zombies" and "Eaten Alive", cannibalism is a category apart from those two objectively speaking. For example, there are situations where a person is driven to cannibalism by circumstances (either forced by third parties or by desperation) or practice it without knowing it.

topic.name: someone is crushed to death
topic.notName: no one is crushed to death
topic.description: A character is killed (or nearly killed) by crushing. Can include being trapped behind moving walls, being trapped inside a garbage compactor, being crushed by falling rocks/rubble/debris, or being run over by a car, tank, or other large vehicle.
topic.listName: where someone is crushed to death

topic.name: there's amputation
topic.keywords: arm foot feet hand finger toe

topicItemStats.comment: The top of Dark Helmet's helmet is crushed when he is thrown into a console, but this protects him from serious injury.

comments.comment: The top of Dark Helmet's helmet is crushed when he is thrown into a console, but this protects him from serious injury.

topicItemStats.comment: At 49:30, someone's entire foot (including their toes) gets flattened by a giant statue. While we see the flattened foot, there's no blood or gore.

comments.comment: At 49:30, someone's entire foot (including their toes) gets flattened by a giant statue. While we see the flattened foot, there's no blood or gore.

topic.name: there's Achilles Tendon injury
topic.description: Some people have severe phobias of tendon or ankle injuries, specifically when they're cut. Pet Sematary, Hostile, etc. show these in graphic detail. Even typing these examples and thinking about those scenes is making me nauseated.

topicItemStats.comment: The king passes out from lack of air.

topic.name: someone struggles to breathe
topic.keywords: choke choking suffocation suffocate strangle strangling
topic.description: Choking, suffocation, strangling, hyperventilating, and things similar can make people incredibly nervous for multiple reasons, such as personal experience.

comments.comment: The king passes out from lack of air.

topicItemStats.comment: The princess is threatened to have her nose job reversed.

comments.comment: The princess is threatened to have her nose job reversed.

topic.name: someone asphyxiates
topic.description: This applies mostly to Space-set content where the body goes through significant harm and deadly trauma when sucked into the vacuum of space but can apply to drownings, claustrophobic environments or violence (which many are particularly sensitive to post the death of George Floyd). Not only that but these situations can be scary for children to watch, the suddenness of many situations where they occur can frighten adults and all viewers should be able to go into a movie aware of what they could see.

topic.name: someone falls to their death
topic.notName: no one falls to their death
topic.doesName: Does someone fall to their death
topic.listName: where someone falls to their death

topicItemStats.doesName: Does someone fall to their death

topic.name: someone falls down stairs
topic.description:
I have a crippling fear of stairs, to the point where I use ramps when walking into restaurants, or I use the elevator to go up 1 floor. 

Characters falling down the stairs triggers this, and I'd like to have a category added so that I can be warned of this

topic.name: an infant is abducted
topic.description: If an infant dies or gets taken away from its mother it triggers a heavy depressive episode in me and I can't be the only one. I know that's a specific one but you see triggers are specific.

topic.name: the R word is used
topic.notName: the R word is not used
topic.description: This is a common and deeply upsetting trigger for developmentally disabled and autistic people, and can cause major panic attacks and meltdowns.
topic.listName: where the R word is used

topic.name: someone overdoses
topic.description: Seeing a character overdose whether it is accidental or not can be extremely triggering for people with PTSD and the character taking drugs category is not specific enough to know if they overdose or not

topicItemStats.comment: Princess Vespa's mother is mentioned in dialog as deceased prior to the film.

comments.comment: Princess Vespa's mother is mentioned in dialog as deceased prior to the film.

topic.name: A child's dear toy is destroyed
topic.description: Similar to having Santa (et al) ruined for a child, a child being in distress due to the damage or destruction of a dear toy such as a sentimental stuffed animal, or a gift from a beloved relative.
topic.listName: where a child's dear toy is destroyed

topicItemStats.comment: Princess Vespa walks out on her wedding to a prince (twice) and falls in love with / marries a different man.

topic.name: someone cheats
topic.description: A character interacts romantically or sexually with someone while in a relationship with a different character. This could be triggering to someone who has been cheated on, or is uncomfortable with the subject.

comments.comment: Princess Vespa walks out on her wedding to a prince (twice) and falls in love with / marries a different man.

topicItemStats.comment: Princess Vespa and Dot Matrix are captured by Dark Helmet.

topic.name: someone is kidnapped
topic.description: Being kidnapped is a very traumatic experience and can be very distressing to read/watch as it almost always against the person's will.

comments.comment: Princess Vespa and Dot Matrix are captured by Dark Helmet.

topicItemStats.comment: There's a very brief scene.

comments.comment: There's a very brief scene.

topic.name: There's audio gore
topic.description: Some people are not bothered by visual depictions of gore but may be sensitive to hearing realistic gory sounds like flesh squishing and bones crunching.

topic.name: someone wets/soils themselves
topic.keywords: poop piss shit pee tinkle shat

topicItemStats.comment: Dark Helmet spits out a mouthful of coffee because it is too hot. The actual moment is at 7:06. You can skip to the next scene at 7:13

comments.comment: Dark Helmet spits out a mouthful of coffee because it is too hot. The actual moment is at 7:06. You can skip to the next scene at 7:13

topicItemStats.comment: One of the main characters is named Barf, so there are jokes based on his name (such as looking sick and about to throw up), but no actual vomiting.

comments.comment: One of the main characters is named Barf, so there are jokes based on his name (such as looking sick and about to throw up), but no actual vomiting.

topic.name: there are 9/11 depictions
topic.description: Anything related to what happened at 9/11. storylines around 9/11 or buildings collapsing in big cities, etc.

topic.name: there is copaganda
topic.description: Celebratory portrayals of unlawful acts by law enforcement.

topicItemStats.comment: Kind of; there's a plastic surgeon who Dark Helmet hires who puts on a surgical mask and threatens to operate on Princess Vespa.

comments.comment: Kind of; there's a plastic surgeon who Dark Helmet hires who puts on a surgical mask and threatens to operate on Princess Vespa.

topic.name: there's a mental institution scene
topic.doesName: Is there a mental institution scene

topicItemStats.doesName: Is there a mental institution scene

topic.name: someone suffers from PTSD
topic.description: There's a category for anxiety attacks, but for me PTSD functions differently. It may seem redundant, but as someone with PTSD, watching someone suffer from PTSD and exhibit symptoms can actually trigger my PTSD. I imagine some other people must feel similarly. Movies would fall into this category if a character talks about having Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder or becomes triggered.

topic.name: someone has an anxiety attack
topic.description: Images of someone having an anxiety attack can trigger an attack in others.  It is not possible to function for a long time afterwards.

topic.name: a mentally ill person is violent
topic.notName: no mentally ill people are violent
topic.description: Showing a mentally ill person committing violent acts is a very specific and very focused trigger for mentally ill people, and people who love someone who is mentally ill. This is separate and distinct from demonizing mental illness. Many mentally ill people are shunned, abused, and murdered because people are frightened of them. Many mentally ill people are extremely poorly treated or even killed because so many people equate mental illness with violence. It is extremely upsetting for a mentally ill person to see a movie that tells them they are frightening and dangerous. Mentally ill people have enough to deal with without having to deal with terror and prejudice. Further, it is extremely upsetting to watch someone you love who has a mental illness watching a movie that shows someone like them being dangerous and violent.
topic.doesName: Is a mentally ill person violent
topic.listName: where a mentally ill person is violent

topicItemStats.doesName: Is a mentally ill person violent

topicItemStats.comment: Pizza the Hutt, a living mound of melted pizza, make some slurping and dripping sounds as he moves that viewers might find off-putting.

topic.name: there's misophonia
topic.description:
Misophonia, or "selective sound sensitivity syndrome", is a neurological disorder often associated with autism and ADHD, in which hearing mouth noises or repetitive sounds like eating, chewing gum, smacking lips, tapping, and other noises when eating, triggers anger, disgust, or even physical pain. 

Many movies and TV shows have moments like this, with some that are so extreme it becomes unwatchable for viewers who suffer from this, as I do. I have wished for this to be a category on this wonderful site for years.

comments.comment: Pizza the Hutt, a living mound of melted pizza, make some slurping and dripping sounds as he moves that viewers might find off-putting.

topicItemStats.comment: There's a throwaway mention of how Pizza the Hutt (a living mound of pizza) ate himself to death offscreen after being locked in a car.

comments.comment: There's a throwaway mention of how Pizza the Hutt (a living mound of pizza) ate himself to death offscreen after being locked in a car.

topic.notName: no one has an eating disorder

topicItemStats.doesName: Does someone have an eating disorder

topic.name: Autism specific abuse
topic.description: When an autistic person is abused specifically because they are autistic. This can include parents who openly complain about their child being "gone" or "different" than they want, bullying by others, medical-related abuse, and parents/relatives/others killing an autistic person because they're "sick" of their autistic behavior.

topic.name: someone says "I'll kill myself"
topic.description: When your life is traumatized after losing a loved one takes their life and a character says "I would kill myself" and other similar phrases or gestures killing self is very painful and all too real and not a joke.
topic.subtitle: National Suicide Prevention Lifeline (1-800-273-8255)
topic.listName: where a character says "I'll kill myself"

topic.name: there's flashing lights or images
topic.description: Flashing lights or rapidly changing or alternating images (e.g. lightning, flickering lights, ambulance lights, gunfire, fast cuts, club scenes, etc.)
topic.doesName: Are there flashing lights or images

topicItemStats.doesName: Are there flashing lights or images

topic.name: a baby cries
topic.description: There are several people with autism who enjoy watching movies but find the sound of babies crying incredibly upsetting and disturbing.

topicItemStats.comment: Multiple times, characters look towards the camera to tell a one-off joke, and there are jokes about how the characters are aware of being in a movie.

topic.name: the fourth wall is broken
topic.notName: the fourth wall is not broken
topic.description: Shows, movies or games that break the fourth wall (For example, a character turning to face the camera and talking to the viewer, or a game tampering with files on the player's computer) may trigger paranoia or anxiety in some people.
topic.listName: where the fourth wall is broken

comments.comment: Multiple times, characters look towards the camera to tell a one-off joke, and there are jokes about how the characters are aware of being in a movie.

topic.name: a baby is stillborn
topic.description: It is important to understand that miscarriage and stillbirth are not the same thing.

topic.name: there's childbirth
topic.description: Tokophobia is a significant fear of childbirth [Wikipedia].

topic.name: there is a baby or unborn child
topic.description: Seeing a baby or unborn child can be triggering to those who have lost an infant or pregnancy, or who have lost a sibling. I lost a late-term pregnancy and seeing a baby unexpectedly can be a very painful reminder of that and trigger flashbacks. Additionally, unborn children (a fetus or embryo) are shown completely unexpectedly at times and can be similarly triggering to those who miscarried, were coerced or forced to have an abortion, or are infertile/unable to conceive. For examples, the horror movie "The Hallow" showed a (possibly dead/deceased) infant crawling across the ground toward a character, which was completely unexpected and irrelevant to the plot, and the TV series Helix had an extended plot depicting a fetus in vitro in the second season.
topic.doesName: Are there babies or unborn children

topicItemStats.doesName: Are there babies or unborn children

topic.name: someone has an abortion
topic.description: Some people have discovered that their parents would have preferred to have aborted them for a variety of reasons. Also some people have been forced to have abortions which can be very traumatic.

topic.name: someone is misgendered
topic.subtitle: Misgendering: What Is It and Why Is It Harmful?
topic.subtitleText: Misgendering: What Is It and Why Is It Harmful?

topic.name: there are homophobic slurs
topic.description: Slurs or insults such as faggot, dike, fair, carpet muncher, etc can make a negative impact on lgbt+ youth.  Such words can upset them to the point of dissociation or ever worse a panic attack.

topic.name: someone says the n-word
topic.keywords: nigger nigga racism racist white black
topic.description: The term nigger is now probably the most offensive word in English. Its degree of offensiveness has increased markedly in recent years, although it has been used in a derogatory manner since at least the Revolutionary War [Dictionary.com]

topicItemStats.comment: Fat is used as an insult twice.

topic.name: there's fat jokes
topic.description: People crack jokes and/or make cruel comments about fat people.

comments.comment: Fat is used as an insult twice.

topicItemStats.comment: Mel Brooks sprinkles in nods to Jewish stereotypes, but mostly to poke fun at them (he's Jewish himself).

topic.name: there's antisemitism
topic.description: Is a movie antisemitic or has the portrayal of antisemitism/antisemitic characters? Are there negative Jewish stereotypes portrayed in the movie, are any explicitly or implied Jewish characters killed or abused? Does the movie feature Nazism/the holocaust? Is the director/write/lead actor a known antisemite? There is a lot of casual antisemitism in media, Jewish individuals (or people who don't want to support antisemitic movies in general) should have access to a warning before going to the theater.
topic.subtitle: Anti-Defamation League

comments.comment: Mel Brooks sprinkles in nods to Jewish stereotypes, but mostly to poke fun at them (he's Jewish himself).

topicItemStats.comment: Cross-eyed people are made fun of and saneist language such as id*ot, st*pid, etc. is used.

topic.name: there's ableist language or behavior
topic.notName: there's no ableist language or behavior
topic.description: This category refers to use of slurs, demeaning language, or abuse of neurodiverse and disabled people. This includes using "autistic" as an insult. This category is important because mocking disabled people or comparing their conditions to being bad is an ableist trope found in many forms of media that feed into a stereotypical narrative.
topic.doesName: Is there ableist language or behavior

comments.comment: Cross-eyed people are made fun of and saneist language such as id*ot, st*pid, etc. is used.

topicItemStats.doesName: Is there ableist language or behavior

topicItemStats.comment: There's a scene in which the Spaceballs capture the stunt doubles of the cast after they hop through an archway. The one playing Princess Vespa (wearing a wedding dress) is actually a balding bearded man smoking a cigar.

topic.name: there are "Man in a dress" jokes
topic.notName: there are no "Man in a dress" jokes
topic.description: A general category for jokes that involve men dressing/acting in traditionally feminine ways or being gnc (gender non-conforming) being used as a joke or for shock value.  Not to be confused with transmisogyny, or calling trans women men in dresses.
topic.doesName: Are there "Man in a dress" jokes

comments.comment: There's a scene in which the Spaceballs capture the stunt doubles of the cast after they hop through an archway. The one playing Princess Vespa (wearing a wedding dress) is actually a balding bearded man smoking a cigar.

topicItemStats.doesName: Are there "Man in a dress" jokes

topic.name: the black guy dies first
topic.notName: a black guy does not die first
topic.description: Having the black character die first or be the only black character to die is a racist trope that people want to know about before they go into a movie so they don't get their hopes up.
topic.doesName: Does the black guy die first
topic.listName: where the black guy dies first

topicItemStats.doesName: Does the black guy die first

topic.name: there's a large age gap
topic.description: Some media depicts relationships/desire between people with large age gaps, either minors feeling romantically for adults or adults expressing interest in minors or people much younger than them. This section would allow people to tag whether there are relationships or desire to have a relationship with someone with a significant age gap or toward a minor, and more detail would be included in comments as to the specifics of the dynamic, as these dynamics can be distressing to witness on screen especially if you have personal experience with predatory behavior from those in a position of power over you.
topic.doesName: Is there a large age gap
topic.listName: where there's a large age gap

topicItemStats.doesName: Is there a large age gap

topicItemStats.comment: There is lots of innuendo and sexual imagery, but not actual sex.

comments.comment: There is lots of innuendo and sexual imagery, but not actual sex.

topic.name: someone is sexually objectified
topic.description: The character is highly sexualized through costumes, performance, and camera angles. Sometimes, they have either the bare minimum or no characterization outside of their sex appeal. Seeing sexually objectified characters can be upsetting for viewers.

topic.name: there are incestuous relationships
topic.description: Tracking incestuous relationships can be helpful for people that have been sexually assaulted and/or abused by siblings. It's important that this not only includes siblings by blood, but also other forms when they were raised as siblings most of their lives. Incest is also sexual relationships between a parent and their child. So people who went through sexual abuse/assault by a parent or maybe a grandparent will also benefit from not seeing any depicted relationships of that kind.
topic.subtitle: National Sexual Assault Hotline 800.656.4673

topic.name: there are nude scenes
topic.keywords: naked sex boob penis butt ass
topic.description: Knowing if there is a nude scene is very important in case you want to watch an appropriate movie with your family or friends

topicItemStats.comment: After Dark Helmet captures Princess Vespa, there's a scene in which he speaks as if he's about to rape her, but it turns out that he is playing with miniature dolls of the cast. He does act out forcing himself on Vespa for a kiss with the dolls.

comments.comment: After Dark Helmet captures Princess Vespa, there's a scene in which he speaks as if he's about to rape her, but it turns out that he is playing with miniature dolls of the cast. He does act out forcing himself on Vespa for a kiss with the dolls.

topic.name: a male character is ridiculed for crying
topic.notName: no male characters get ridiculed for crying
topic.description: As someone who has been made fun of for crying multiple times by abusive friends, this is incredibly triggering. It's often portrayed as a joke, and it's just something I want to avoid. Many men are victims of abuse and get made fun of for it or told that they can't be abused, and would be helped by being able to know ahead of time whether or not that happens.
topic.doesName: Is a male character ridiculed for crying
topic.listName: where a male character is ridiculed for crying

topicItemStats.doesName: Is a male character ridiculed for crying

topic.name: someone has a stroke
topic.description: Strokes may be a trigger for some people, especially those with trauma relating to them.

topic.name: someone is homeless
topic.description: A friend of mine has severe anxiety that is triggered by the premise of being homeless, due to trauma from having been homeless themself. It would be extremely helpful if there was some way to know which pieces of media have homeless characters, or characters that become homeless at some point so that my friend can avoid re-living this trauma. An example of this happening is in the movie A Dog's Journey.

topic.description: Although the category of "Does a Car Crash?" is helpful, there are often times when the answer to that question is no, but someone slams on the horn or screeches their tires and this can still be triggering to those impacted by car crashes, even if a crash is not present.

topic.name: there's gun violence
topic.keywords: firearm gun massacre attack school active shooter weapon shoot shooting
topic.description: Gun violence/shootings, or even simply the discharge of firearms. Guns in media can easily trigger PTSD and warnings are especially important for survivors of gun violence and veterans.
